havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.storage.lightning module¶

class havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.storage.lightning.Lightning[source]¶

Bases: object

static check_for_bit_errors(nvmelogdir, verbose=False)[source]¶

Check for bit errors in an I/O test. This function looks through the files in the NVMe log directory to find the first and last log files. Then the error counts in the initial and final logs are compared. If they are different, then an error must have occurred at some point during the test.

Parameters

  • nvmelogdir – location of log files to review

  • verbose – print extra information

static gen_nvme_smartlogs(logdir, runtime, verbose=False, nvme_delay=675)[source]¶

Periodically collect NVMe smart log data. Arguments:

Parameters

  • logdir (str) – log directory

  • runtime (int or str) – run time in seconds

  • verbose (bool) – print extra information

  • nvme_delay (int) – delay between log operations

static sel_psxapp(logdir, runtime, verbose=False, switchtec_delay=720)[source]¶

Periodically gather SEL and sensor logs.

Parameters

  • logdir (str) – log directory

  • runtime (int or str) – run time in seconds

  • verbose (bool) – print extra information

  • switchtec_delay – delay between log operations

compare_attributes(smart_data_before, smart_data_after, devices, json_data)[source]¶
evaluate_expression(actual, expected, opr, msg, lower_val=0, increment_by=0)[source]¶

The function takes expected and actual value and perform comparison between them. Logical operators supported are: ‘<’ -> less then ‘>’ -> greater then ‘>=’-> greater then equal to ‘<=’-> less then equal to ‘=’ -> check equality, similar to == ‘-‘ -> inbetween range (lower_val is require) ‘/’ -> multiple options (existence of word in a string) ‘~’ -> increment the ‘expected’ by “increment_by” and compare

class havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.storage.storage_device.StorageDeviceFactory[source]¶

Bases: object

As Drive related test can’t be performed with different drive types, StorageDeviceFactory needs drives of same type.
